title: Microsoft Windows Defender Directory Junction Denial-of-Service Vulnerability
description:
This vulnerability allows local attackers to create a denial-of-service condition on affected installations of Microsoft Windows. An attacker must first obtain the ability to execute low-privileged code on the target system in order to exploit this vulnerability.
The specific flaw exists within Windows Defender. By creating a directory junction, an attacker can abuse Windows Defender to delete a file. An attacker can leverage this vulnerability to create a denial-of-service condition on the system.
addtionnal_details: Microsoft has issued an update to correct this vulnerability. More details can be found at:https://msrc.microsoft.com/update-guide/vulnerability/CVE-2021-34471
timeline:
2021-05-05 - Vulnerability reported to vendor
2021-08-11 - Coordinated public release of advisory
